titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Leonid N. Stolovich papers M1624
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Elga Zalite

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-08-07T09:18-0700

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

physdesc.extent: 80 boxes; 14 boxes of books de-accn 7/2008; leaving 52 boxes of mss material and some newspapers.

did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36-48 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/spc.html.
did.abstract: The Leonid N. Stolovich papers include a wide range of correspondence with philosophers, literary authors, and scholars of literature and art, among others.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Leonid Naumovich Stolovich (1929-2013) received his degrees from Leningrad University and was professor emeritus of the Philosophy Department of Tartu University in Estonia. He specialized in the fields of aesthetics, axiology and the history of philosophy. He is the author of more than forty books and 400 publications in 20 languages.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased by Stanford University, Special Collections in 2007.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Leonid N. Stolovich papers, 1939-2007 (M1624). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Stolovich papers are divided into 9 separate series: Personal Papers, Correspondence, Creative Works, Research Works by others, Art Work by others, Conference materials, Newspapers and magazines, Newspaper clippings, and Audiovisual materials.
